replies.body: When the German was asked why he didn't like Aurelion Sol said: "Vel, Koz  I really don't like dragons."

What's the point to having his Star's be visible in bushes? 

I feel like that removes a huge vision play element that no other champion has to deal with in a negative way. Evelynn can go anywhere and not be seen, but he is almost always seen no matter what he does. To me that seems unfair to Aurelion Sol. You want to recall in a bush, nope because the enemy Lee Sin will know exactly where to Q and hit you based on the stars. Any other champion would have a chance to recall safely.
Just think if an enemy champion was close enough to a bush to be hit by his stars, they would be taking damage from an invisible source and that would be incredibly unfair
After the first hit he would be revealed.
Yes because being hit be invisible things isn't in the game {{champion:20}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:20}}

Perhaps, but trying to flash juke when your being chased can be pretty instrumental in surviving, but that's a large element of game play he simply can do, and they can see it from much further away. The W ACTIVE probably should be visible, but the passive should definitely NOT be visible unless you are being hit by it.
doesnt stop it from happening from sun fire cape?
I don't think it works like that. Things like rumble's or sion's Q aren't visible from outside a bush (unless I've missed an update). I don't see why Aurelion's passive would be treated differently.

It is though. there was a post on the PBE about it last I saw.

Center of the Universe (Passive): [no gameplay change but tooltip now specifies - "The Stars can be visible to enemies even if Aurelion Sol is in brush"]
http://www.surrenderat20.net/2016/03/315-pbe-update.html
All right, in that case I feel like that needs to be changed. Especially if it's like some spell effects that can be seen even when you don't have vision of the area.
Yeah I agree as well. No other champions stuff can be seen, so why will his be?

Because he's extremely arrogant and believes no one can truly pose a threat to him. So why bother hiding from such insignificant beings? After all, he is the... wait for it... Center of the Universe.

On a more serious note, this is probably a good question to bring up during the Q&A for balance purposes.
if anything, they should have his stars come back when hes recalling, when he gets knocked up they return to him.

I really like him as a champion but i have one issue. Why does his ultimate feel so anti-climatic. To me it feels as if his ultimate doesn't make sense with his character or his kit as a whole. Being a star forger his ultimate should, in my opinion, have something to do with a star, like consuming his 3 stars to form a black hole/ causing an explosion, not just a line of damage and a knock back. Would really like some feedback on this.

I completely agree. To me they need to change his Q to his R and his R to his Q. I love the fire breathe, hes a dragon after all, but its so anti climatic compared to his Q which has the potential to grow as large as the dragon and baron pits combined.

I TOTALLY agree! I was thinking the same thing. His whole kit kind of revolves around his stars whether it be expanding their range, throwing one, or sucking them up and flying as one, then his ult is like... huh? No stars, not tied to his kit at all. Its very anticlimactic, it really doesn't feel "dragon-y" Its almost supporty rather than powerful. The damage isn't even that great, definitely not the kind of damage I'd expect from a Star Dragon.
Agreed. His ult is called Star Fire (i think). It needs more oomph befitting of a dragon's space fire. Space fire is pretty hot, guys. Because stars are hot.

A black hole wouldn't make sense because Aurelion Sol creates stars, and he considers doing it a work of art, the stars are kinda his children, it hurts him to see them destroyed. A black hole is a dead star, he'd never kill his own work. The reason his Q is what it is, is because of balance. He needs that stun on a short CD, and it was made with comboing with E in mind. THE ult fits in the kit due to the fact that it works with W. Besides the breath weapon has almost always been a dragons Iconic weapon, that's why its the ult, its starFire breath
Didn't he crush a star in his release video?
i agree, his ult should be a little more devastating, maybe if it was a cone or longer range and could hit more units, or if you charged it like poppy, it would knock them back farther?
When we he be officially released?
That's actually my only question right now. Looks like a great champ.

That isn't a question Riot willingly awnsers, though. They always are wanting to tweak the champion and balance them somewhat before putting them on live. There really is no telling how long bugs could delay his release. The earliest he will come out is when they ship out the next patch, which, if they are following schedule, should be Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday next week.

"......balance them somewhat"
Yeah Ekko was very balanced when he came out. So was Tahm and Illaoi. Lol
That is why I said somewhat. PBE isn't perfect, the playerbase and thus data provided is extremely small compared to the whole of us.
